website_summaries.verdict: The perfect case for runners who need a belt to carry extra-large smartphones and accessories.
pros: Large phone pouch able to hold larger smartphones
Second pouch available for smaller items
cons: Many owners had trouble with customer service

website_summaries.verdict: Buyers seeking a running belt to hold their plus-sized phones will find their match in this highly-rated model.
pros: Headphone opening in pocket for easy listening
Has reflective lining for night joggers
Larger pockets can fit most smartphones
Includes smaller zippered pockets for valuables
cons: Larger smartphones in bulky cases can have trouble fitting into the belt

customer_reviews.title: Great for chubby chics!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I'm a fat chic (215 lbs) and I needed a running belt that would fit and not make extra lumps on my already lumpy body. It's so comfortable too! Note, I wore it over my running pants so it wasn't directly on skin. I accidentally ordered 2 by accident and my husband tried one. He's also overweight and it rubbed a bit on his stomach because he wore it directly on skin, so I suggest wearing this over a shirt to prevent rubbage if you're heavier. Fits my iPhone 6 and keys no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Crys

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Obese People!
customer_reviews.text: My Fitbit has connected GPS which requires that I carry my cellphone to log my miles and this works perfectly for a hands free workout! I'm very obese and this is very comfortable while walking and you can't even notice that you're wearing it as it hides discreetly under your shirt!!! I was so afraid that it would look like a fanny pack but not even close! It will be a great tool for my weight loss journey!
customer_reviews.author: bwawcpl

customer_reviews.title: Great for large phones w/ otterbox case too!
customer_reviews.text: Can fit my iPhone 6+ WITH an otterbox still on it. I don't have the extra heavy otterbox w/ belt attachment but it's still quite a bulky case and this belt can fit that and my keys in the two pockets and it's perfectly comfortable. Gives a nice tight fit. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Arsalan Chishty

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Not heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Not heavy, can adjust very easily. Plenty of space for my iPhone 8 along with car keys and gel packs for long runs. UPDATE 3/24/18!!! Tomorrow I am set to run my 1st half marathon, and unfortunately the zipper decided to break on me, and I am left with nothing to use for my race. I will have to carry my phone (not ideal since it is supposed to rain). VERY disappointed that this happened; it didnt even last me 2 months (and i do most of my training with HIIT on the treadmill and one long run a week, so I have only used this maybe 6 times since i bought it)
customer_reviews.author: Mike Convertino

customer_reviews.title: Nice high quality running belt
customer_reviews.text: This is the first running belt i have used. I wanted one that was high quality, water resistant, a hole for the headphone wires, easily adjustable, light, space for phone and keys and ?, comfortable and not noticeable. This belt satisfies these aspects. Before purchasing i read many of the reviews. They are accurate in their descriptions. I wear this belt when i run intervals and long distance - if i want to listen to music. By the way, i put the phone in airplane mode and listen to music downloaded to my playlists. So little radiation ... important especially for long runs. So, overall 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Thunder Storm

customer_reviews.title: Good for running
customer_reviews.text: The belt is comfortable and fits my larger cell phone. The "skinny" looking pockets unfolds as the items are placed inside. I purchased this because it is water resistant; so it will protect items inside and it looks a lot better than fanny packs.
customer_reviews.author: purple shopper

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Very insightful product. Exactly what I was looking for in a running belt: compact but expands to roomy for all the stuff I need while exercising/running, durable not flimsy, waterproof, easy to adjust on my hip, stays in place, etc. Perfect! Accommodates my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge with room to spare for a driver's license, house and car keys, pepper spray, and folding knife.
customer_reviews.author: PDT

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for my use
customer_reviews.text: Yes! It is perfect for my use! I am not a runner-- I bought it to use for my many airplane flights this fall and it is perfect for that purpose! I am handicapped and will be using a cane through multiple airport gates and would like the ease of carrying my phone, money and other miscellaneous items in a safe place.... I feel confident with this belt on. Worth the reasonable price and very good quality!!! Also was delivered quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Phyl

customer_reviews.title: No more annoying armband
customer_reviews.text: I always hated any workout armband I tried. Everything about this belt is great. I use it at the gym to carry my phone, headphones, locker key, and chapstick. And there's room for a little more than that too. I was a little nervous to order a fanny pack (because, you know, fanny packs), but this has a very low profile once on and is hardly noticeable. There's a reinforced hole off the larger, phone size zipper pocket that is great for running headphones through. The two pouches are also lined with some plastic material that makes it so your sweat doesn't soak through.
customer_reviews.author: Anna G

customer_reviews.title: Great belt!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. I use it for holding my car keys and an iPhone 7 while I jog and they fit in the 2 pockets very well. The belt and contents do not bounce around and is comfortable against my skin. The moisture barrier on the inside of the belt keeps the items from being soaked with sweat but would probably not protect them from a downpouring of rain. The reflective surface is a nice touch but it is only applied to the pocket side of the belt. It would be nice if it were applied all the way around for maximum visibility at night. Really great product and would recommend to any jogger or hiker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Skaar

customer_reviews.title: Not for big phones!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice belt and I wanted to be able to use it BUT if you have a large phone this will not work for you. Just not big enough and it was a struggle to try and remove it if you were walking or running. Couldn’t zip it closed either so back it went. However, the additional compartment would be a nice addition for keys.
customer_reviews.author: angie c

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little belt
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little belt, fits a set of keys, iPhone, a chapstick, perhaps a gel pack, and some tissues. Best part is that the keys can be separated from the phone in a second smaller pocket so your phone doesn't get scratched. Comfortable to wear; have run with it a few times since purchase and it doesn't get in the way or bother me at all. Quality seems good and price is right. Very good purchase and I anticipate using it often.
customer_reviews.author: raji

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Value, Great Quality. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: GREAT!! I got this as a replacement for a belt I misplaced. This seems to be much better quality at about half the price of my previous belt plus has a second separate area to hold cash, a key or cards which my old one didn't have. This is important because I would constantly risk dropping cash or my key when I would take out phone during a run while changing music apps or tracks. A definite "recommend". Also it does accommodate my Samsung Galaxy 6 Edge + with no problem (even though a bit wider than an Iphone.) Also... I noticed there is a small opening for earbud cord which my old one didn't have.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Spacious Storage
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews for a lot of these before purchasing and this one seemed to be the best fit for what I needed. I used the first time in a 5K last weekend and it was PERFECT. There is one large pouch, which fit my HTC One M8 easily, even with the case on it. The smaller pouch was just the right size for carrying the largish key fob for my car along with my ID. The belt was easy to adjust and stayed in place. It was so comfortable I forgot I was wearing it, even when sitting, that I actually checked a couple times to make sure it was still there!
customer_reviews.author: Rowdy Cat

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these running belts for a couple of years and just purchased one as a gift for a running friend. I like the two pouches. I keep small key and GPS fobs in the smaller side and my phone plus small ID wallet plus lip gloss in the larger side. (phone is 5.8" x 3" in a thick case) I use this all the time for half marathons, training runs, and casual walks. It has survived many rainy runs and kept the contents dry. I also like that the band is adjustable on both ends. Sometimes I wear it at my waist and other times around my hips.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for shorter runs under 45 min.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS RUNNING BELT! (Yes, the all caps is on purpose) Although, this is not a hydration belt, it is truly perfect for runs shorter than 45 min. where you don't need to hydrate during your runs. I don't notice it during the runs which, to me, is the true test of a good running belt. I absolut recommended this to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: wviking

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing this belt. The first lasted almost two years of using it for running nearly every day. One zipper is off its track on one side and the elastic is getting stretched out, but it seems like a reasonable lifetime. The belt has worked very well, holding a large phone and keys. It is comfortable, hardly noticeable while running. No bounce and easily adjustable to a comfortable tightness.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Nice item for great price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these one for me and one for a pal. I was a bit skeptical about this bcs I am a large gal. (Size 18 clothes and 210 lbs) The belts is able to expand in 2 area's of the waist band. The waist band is made of a nice high quiality material. I was very please with this. My phone (a Galaxy 9+Note) is rather large and it fits nicely in the zip up pocket. Only tiny wish would be that the pocket for the phone was a smidge bigger fo the large phones many have.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rae

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look like a fanny belt!!
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect, just what I needed! I can wear it under my shirt and it doesn't look ridiculously bulky, holds my phone, debit card, driver's license, and key fob. I don't put my keys in there because I have 100 keys and it would weigh it down but it would certainly hold a car key and a house key.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Belts
customer_reviews.text: Hands down my favorite of all the running belts I've owned. It's comfortable, stays in place, and has 2 separate pockets, so I don't have to worry about my keys scratching my phone. Excellent customer service too!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great running belt
customer_reviews.text: Great running belt! The belt is slim, but the large pocket easily expands to fit my Nexus 6 phone (a huge phone!) and the belt is stable enough that I forget I'm wearing it within a couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Herc

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a vacation (to a theme park) actually, I thought it would be great for keeping my money and phone (basic necessities) on me rather than having a separate bag I would risk losing and risk having to remove for rides. It was great, kept everything close, safe, was discreet, comfortable, and perfect for running around all day. Much better than others I had found in the store. I would definitely recommend. Also, I have a galaxy s 5 phone, which I was also able to fit (with otter case) into the large compartment. There isn't a lot of room, but perfect for basic essentials.
customer_reviews.author: vk9

customer_reviews.title: You have found the right belt for running
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved to an apartment that has a running track right next to it. I wanted to run on it but didn't have a place to put my keys for my place and they would fall out of pockets. So I researched how to solve this problem and it was running belts or tying the key to your shoe lace. So I bought this running belt. Boy was it the right choice, I have ran in the rain, and my phone is dry and perfect. I will use this belt until it wears out which I do not seeing coming anytime soon. And when it does I will buy the same things.
customer_reviews.author: WarrDawg

customer_reviews.title: Keeps things in place while you walk or run.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a while now and I really like the fact that it works as expected. The clip holds up well and whole waking or running it definetly stays in place and keeps the items inside. The water resistance is a good thing also as I sweat a lot and it seems to keep the sweat out. The inmhnthig I would have liked would have been an extra pocket to put an additional item, but overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Not made for OCR's
customer_reviews.text: Not made to be put through tough runs/races. I use these primarily for shorter distance Spartan Races/OCR races, anything under 10 miles. Just need something to hold some gels/chews, and mustard packets. This belt would be awesome if it would last more than 1 or 2 (if I'm lucky) races. Not sure if the mud gets caught in the teeth of the zipper, but I've gone through a couple of these things after a race because the zipper will not stay closed. Nice product, but it just doesn't fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT running belt!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE the double pocket/pouch. This allows me EXTRA EASY access to my phone without worry of losing my keys (which would normally be in the same pocket). Even better, no more scratching my phone with my keys or misc items carried in together. I can now take out my phone from the belt while still running and slip it right back in without a worry. I LOVE the fact that it has head phone easy access. This has made my running life SOOOO much better! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: LizG

customer_reviews.title: Bad zipper, failed to follow through on promotion.
customer_reviews.text: Initially, loved the product. Within one month, the zipper in the smaller pocket came undone. I continued to use it after I reset it (sort of). But to this day, it continues to come undone. The elastic adjustable belt is also loses its elasticity after a few months, but I I’d give it a pass perhaps under wear and tear. Also as a footnote, the company offered a free running belt with a posted review. The free running belt never came. I really wanted to like this product, but given the cheap zipper, elasticity issue, and failed promotion follow through, I will look for a different company.
customer_reviews.author: TKL

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place
customer_reviews.text: My last running belt never felt tight enough on my waist and even when cinched "tight," it just bounced around with a phone and keys in there. This fits my iphone XS max in one compartment and my keys in another without a problem and, most importantly, doesn't bounce when I run. I use bluetooth headphones so this is irrelevant but I did appreciate the fact that there's an actual hole for a headphone jack, which none of my prior belts have had. It's also really easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: R. GilbertTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality - Great Value - HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Being one who reads TONS of reviews before making a purchase, I was also VERY impressed by this running belt. Pricing -> excellent, shipping time -> excellent, overall quality -> excellent! I typically do not care to carry or have bells and whistles with me during a run so the size, sleekness and weight of this belt were very important. When wearing the belt it feels like it is barely there! Also a huge plus that my iPhone 6s Plus fits nicely in the bigger pocket. I will be looking forward to water testing the belt during Florida wet runs! So far - I HIGHLY recommend this running belt. Thank you Sport2People!
customer_reviews.author: JDo

customer_reviews.title: This product is excellent, I am a big person and I need ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent, I am a big person and I need to listen to my internet radio on my phone while working out and this item does an excellent job keeping my phone and keys on me and keeping them waterproof while working out, definitely worth the money and I love that this product is slim, adjustable with a buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SCAM
customer_reviews.text: SCAM LIE I lost my phone with this product It’s said water proof I had my iPhone XS in there, for less than 3 minutes under water My phone and my car key got water damage. Don’t waste your money. AMAZON SHOULD STOP HAVING SCAMS ON THEIR WEBSITE
customer_reviews.author: Arman

customer_reviews.title: Use is for cycling, perfect for my cell phone holster, sturdy belt
customer_reviews.text: I'm excited about this fitness belt. I'm not a runner. I'm a cyclist, and I take my phone with me, on my hip with the ballistic phone case and holster...I've been thru two fitness belts. Each had a not so durable belt, which was very flexible, not sturdy. I was using a fanny pack, and it had a better belt, but then it broke. This new fitness belt has the sturdy belt that will hold my cell phone holster just fine. And the zipper pockets are great too. Very well built! Very reasonable price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Howey

customer_reviews.title: i wear it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt, it's so convenient. I pack my credit cards, ID, and cash in it, and maybe a pocket knife (for hiking), and just wear it every day. No purse!!! Yay! Just run out the door. Two things, though. The belt stretches. You will need to adjust it ever time you put it on. And the first belt I bought had a zipper that failed after less than a year. They're plastic. Otherwise, I wear it every day!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTWEIGHT, ATTRACTIVE, GREAT SERVICE.
customer_reviews.text: This was a blue light special on my computer...when I clicked on order details, among the assets was "amazon prime". The product has been excellent for my use. It is lightweight Holds my phone, keys, and card/ $ if necessary. The service via amazon was excellent. The Sport2people are outstanding . I bought a second belt for my runner daughter.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: You need this belt!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best running belt ever! I used it during my half marathon and it didn't move or slide around. I fit my ID, debit card, & small pack of gum in the smaller side. I fit my iPhone 6 & my iPod Touch in the larger side, no problem! There was a hole for my headphone cord to fit through as well. I highly suggest purchasing this belt.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but I have only used this a ...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: STILL HAVE NOT HEARD BACK FROM THIS SELLER ABOUT A REPLACEMENT! VERY POOR SERVICE. CHANGING TO ONE STAR! Love it, but I have only used this a few times and the zip has broken. Everything else with this product is great. Hopefully I can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Waynne

customer_reviews.title: This is a great belt! I was looking for a belt to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great belt! I was looking for a belt to carry my phone and the essential cards on my daily walks. My belt arrived promptly as promised and in perfect shape. I have used it for about a week and it is great. The pouches are well-sized to accommodate everything you need. The phone pouch is designed to accommodate ear buds. The belt seems very well made. It was easy to adjust to my size. Sits on your waist and with a T-shirt on you can't even see it. Best thing is I can hardly feel it when I am wearing it walking. A lot of thought went into this belt and it shows.
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: Initial thoughts... I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's still early but I have a bunch of race shorts with no pockets. This belt replaces my stretched out spy belt. So far it fights nice and tight without being too tight. I would give it 5 stars but it's still a little abrasive against the skin for long runs, so wear it over the shorts for those. You need to practice putting in your phone in and out but once you get the dance down, it's easy and should avoid accidental drops. LOVE the second pocket, and works well in front (for frequent access) or back. Back is great but if your run too much and lose your backside it might bounce a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome running belt
customer_reviews.text: best running belt you can oreder for its size!! I have used this belt now for the last week,onAverage I run 4 to 5 miles a day, this belt has made carrying my phone and keys so easy, it's so comfortable you will forget you have it on.. I would recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Good running belt, with one exception.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I ordered. I lost the first one, and liked it enough to order the same one again. It's great for traveling, as you can run with your phone, hotel key and credit cards, and a few other items. My only gripe is that it slides down easily, so a few small silicone anti-slip strips on the back would be awesome! (Hint Hint sport2people)
customer_reviews.author: Scott L

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: This belt allows me to hold my phone (iPhone Max Pro) at my waist comfortably on my runs/walks. Since I use cordless headphones or play music through the speakers, the hole for the headset doesn’t get used but it’s a nice feature. The best part about it, is the fact that it’s adjustable and does not bounce when you walk or run. Great value, and great product.
customer_reviews.author: LSW1797

customer_reviews.title: Kids should be removed from the title
customer_reviews.text: Giving this 3 stars because it is partially my fault for not measuring my son prior to ordering, but the title stated for kids so I guess I just assumed it was adjustable enough to fit kids. It might fit a 12 year old, but I doubt it would fit anyone younger unless they are large for their age. I guess another lesson that you can't take an item for what it says and need to make sure to do your own diligence.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It's alright, you should probably research other items
customer_reviews.text: It's ok.. I would recommended buying something else. It can be a pain getting certain items in and out(wallets, larger phones or smaller phones with thick case). Do not put anything that your would need to get to quickly in it (ie. Pepper spray, knife or a taser) . After using it for about a month, I believe the zipper should be on the top of the pockets and not in the middle of the front
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved that there was no bounce abs no chafing
customer_reviews.text: Just tried it out this morning. I had keys in the little pocket and my Samsung Galaxy 5 in the big pocket (phone was in one of those wallet cases so there's my DL, credit card, and some cash), which stretched out quite well for what I needed with room to spare. I did 6.72 miles of jogging and walking with the pockets up against my back. I loved that there was no bounce abs no chafing. I had Bluetooth earphones so didn't try the earphone hole in the belt. All in all, a great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ung

customer_reviews.title: Deceptively Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I used my SPIbelt for 6+ years and loved it. I lost it before it wore out, so I came to Amazon to buy a new one, found this belt, and decided to try it out. When I pulled it out of the box, I was disappointed. This thing is massive compared to my SPIbelt. I knew it would be a huge hassle to run in. Turns out, I was completely wrong. I've been running in it for two months now, and I don't feel it at all – not even a little bit. It is deceptively amazing, and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pike

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should - fits iPhone 11
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. My iPhone 11 with a case and popsocket fit in the larger part. Keys can fit in the smaller portion. It’s just like a small version of a fanny pack I guess but you can hide it better. My husband says it looks goofy but if you don’t have a pocket then it’s helpful! Getting your phone out while wearing it is a bit difficult. Some brands have where you can touch through the pack, but I don’t know how well they work. When I’m out walking the dog and don’t have pockets this is good enough and I just accept that it may look goofy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great gear great price!
customer_reviews.text: Love the slim fit and the fact that it has separate pockets for keys. I'd been looking for something that would work with my new huge device (iPhone 6s plus)...this is perfect! Also love that the pockets have a moisture barrier to protect from the blood, sweat and tears of any workout.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: I didn't really believe at first that it'll all fit...
customer_reviews.text: So... I got this because a running belt I got at Target was way too big. I unpack this thing from the Amazon box, and I'm like "there's no way my iPhone 11 Pro will fit in here." Lo and behold, it did. With room to spare. And not only that - the whole thing doesn't look or feel like it will explode. I'd definitely order another.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Stojic

customer_reviews.title: Good for runs, a bit cumbersome for running errands after
customer_reviews.text: The front pocket was able to hold my iphone 7+ with a slim case, but it took a bit of effort to get it in there. It held up well during the run and I hardly noticed that it was there at all. But it became cumbersome to take out the cards and phone when I had to use it for grocery shopping later. Maybe a top zip would have been better than a size zip.
customer_reviews.author: 0_phe1ia

customer_reviews.title: The belt is lightweight and fits an iphone perfectly with a great compartment for headphones
customer_reviews.text: The customer service is phenonemanal! No, I did not need to contact the seller. The seller reached out to me to ensure my satisfaction. The belt is lightweight and fits an iphone perfectly with a great compartment for headphones. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Reg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product - Perfect For Runners
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this runner's belt, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend or repurchase this item. In fact, I've even considered ordering a second belt, just to have some fun and variety with a second color option! By the way, I've already had occasion to test the waterproofness, and my phone stayed completely dry while running and slogging through an absolute downpour. I'd estimate I've used the belt through fifty or sixty runs so far. Not enough to rate longterm durability, but enough, I think, to have a favorable initial impression and product experience.
customer_reviews.author: Nozama

customer_reviews.title: I really love this.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this....it stretches a ton and still looks very discrete under my running shirt. The belt portion is strong and I love the reflective lines because I run at night and it makes me visible. Lastly, I love the fact that the pockets are waterproof. Made extremely well. If it becomes available, I will definitely get it in my favorite color...purple.
customer_reviews.author: t40

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I normally use an arm band when running. Ran my 1st half marathon and order this for it. The adjustable belt stayed snug and did not loosen. It rained the entire time. This kept my phone dry and held my energy gels. I'll never use my arm bands again. I have a Samsung S8+. It fit perfectly without the phone case on it. With the phone case, it was a tight fit. I have a low profile spigen case if you're wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect. I may even try using it at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product earlier this week. Used it for the first time last night. I was a volunteer for VBS and just needed to carry around my phone, car key and charge cards. It was perfect. I may even try using it at the gym. Really like the adjustable size and the fact that it stretches.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Awesome running belt to track your steps and distance on cel phone
customer_reviews.text: Where do I begin, I tested it yesterday on a running track and I absolutely loved it. Light, keeps cell phones like iPhone 6 snugg to your body, no wobbling, to keep track of steps and distance on health apps while walking, running and hiking. Perfect for runners, walkers, and hikers, the owner is very friendly and genuine, and love the quote by Confucius on the package "The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: holds what I need
customer_reviews.text: Got this to wear at spartan/ tough mudders because wearing a camelback was just annoying. This was able to hold my samsung s8, car key, some gatorade chewables, salt packets. Just what I needed. Once on and moving, it didn't move around much, under the t-shirt or over it. My only complaint would be that the pockets do not stretch at all, so if you have a larger phone it may not fit. I had to use the "larger pocket for my phone and it was pretty snug. But maybe this was a good thing because it kept it from bouncing around? Nice product, would recommend to others for obstacles races.
customer_reviews.author: M. disalvatore

customer_reviews.title: Very secure, simple design and it fits my huge iPhone 8 Plus !
customer_reviews.text: I love this ! It’s great for working out wherever you go whether it be the gym or out on a run. It stays around your waist and doesn’t bounce up and down. It doesn’t slide up unless you’re wearing pretty thin/slick clothing. I’m able to fit my keys and my iPhone 8 Plus ! It’s super helpful since not all women’s athletic wear have useful pockets. It’s very minimal so it keeps you from packing too much (even though it is pretty capable since it expands a good amount). Definitely recommend and I might be buying another just to have multiple colors :)
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Good water resistance and fits my items
customer_reviews.text: I have gone on several runs using this product and it was worked well for me so far. I use wireless headphones so I cannot speak to the headphone cord port, but the larger pocket easily fits my phone with room to spare while the smaller one fits my keys and a protein bar. I like that it holds my items snugly against my body (I hate have my stuff bouncing around as I run.) I have gone running in the rain and my stuff has remained dry. I am not a particularly sweaty person, but I have worn it under my shirt as well as over a tighter shirt without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without it?
customer_reviews.text: After months of having a soggy cell phone from storing it in my running bra, I said to myself, "Self, there has to be a better way." I found this belt and ordered it. It's perfect. It has two compartments so car keys and a tissue go in the smaller side, cell phone in the larger. The only thing about it I'm not crazy about is the the lining grabs at the phone making it tough to put away while you're jogging. I wash it once a week (in a mesh bag on delicate, line dry). The pesky lining is finally starting to wear away (after a year) but the belt is holding up beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic Flamingo

customer_reviews.title: Nice, compact, inexpensive, and adjustable running belt.
customer_reviews.text: Thinner version belt than the Flipbelt. I own both. I Iike this belt for shorter runs when I don't "need" water with me immediately at the end of the run. I know, I know; you should drink water after every run. But running with a water bottle can be cumbersome. This belt holds your essentials: ID, keys, gum, some cash, and even pepper spray, if needed. Inexpensive and comfortable belt. Love that its adjustable too. Its subtle as well. Not bulky at all, unless your phone is a mini tablet; which wouldn't fit anyway Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: M. Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: My iphone7Plus barely fit in the larger pocket and during my run my running app would go into Pause mode and then quickly resume. I don't know if my screen was rubbing against something. I had screen off. But very annoying and happened at least once a mile on 6 mile run. I finally took phone out and just held it like I'm used to. The other smaller pocket is really small, did not fit my wallet. Maybe a couple credit cards and a key. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bm17fly

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this belt. It is adjustable to fit most waist sizes. I usually wear a size 12 jean and this belt could go a lot bigger if necessary. It stays in place during a run. Once i had it adjusted to the correct size the belt didn't move out of place once. I do a lot of trail running and this belt is a god send! I wouldn't run without it!
customer_reviews.author: C.Payne!

customer_reviews.title: this belt is perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a belt to wear at work- under my shirt, unnoticed, to hold my phone, chapstick, gym, etc... this belt is perfect!!! Lightweight, holds my stuff easily without being bulky!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully sleek
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I wished it was bigger but then I realize its just the right size for me. Any bigger and I would be carrying extra stuff I can do without. Love how sleek it is and it just disappears under my shirt. Yes I don't like it over my shirt - my shirt and shorts ha already reflective strips to light me in the dark. Love this.
customer_reviews.author: Mode S.

customer_reviews.title: Great belt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this belt for my husband as he was worried about items falling out of his pockets when running. He's very impressed as he can put everything he wants to carry in the expandable pockets without feeling weighed down or that things will be lost along his run. I tried it out one day while we were running and liked it so much I got one for myself too! It also fits well under my shirt so I don't look like I have strange lumps around my waist.
customer_reviews.author: Raembee

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly, isn't noticeable when running
customer_reviews.text: I was originally looking at an arm band to keep my phone while running, but some reviews said they slide, or have other issues. I didn't know about these belt/holders, but I'm glad I stumbled on it. It works perfectly for what I needed. I wanted to carry my phone so I could track my run, and jam out while doing so. Not much else to say. It's flexible for a snug fit that doesn't bounce, the pockets are easy to access, and it has plenty of room. Seems to be good quality too, though I haven't had it too long.
customer_reviews.author: Joey D.

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job holding phone and does NOT bounce.
customer_reviews.text: Wore this belt on 8 mile run with Nexus 5x inside. Belt did not bounce and the phone fit easily in expanding pouch. Seem to be very water resistant which is a big plus. Belt was comfortable to wear while running.
customer_reviews.author: Uber traveler

customer_reviews.title: fits iphone X with otterbox big case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great belt. I read some reviews that scared me about folks having issues with fitting an iphone but I was able to fit my iphone X with the huge otterbox case around it. Ya, it was tight but fit without ruining the belt. I have another smaller case now for my phone and my phone fits super duper easy in the pouch. its a GREAT product! well built
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Good, but zipper broke after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Product was good and lasted me for about a year before the zipper broke. I would regularly carry my phone [Galaxy active s8], keys, and some clif shots in there. I'm not sure if I will be purchasing another one, as I have really grown to like the cloth, "flip belt" style belts more.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Well-made -- not perfect for someone whose hips are xs
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a wonderful running belt, but I do wish it could tighten an inch more for myself because, for me, it does indeed bounce / slip around unless I'm wearing an extra layer of of clothing. My hips are 36" and waist is 25" and where the belt rests I'm about 29" -- if the belt were just a little tighter or I were just a little wider there, I imagine it wouldn't bounce at all. The main pocket fits my huge iphone 6+ perfectly -- and I use the other pocket to store a roll of poop bags for my dog (pretty convenient!).
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great for Running and taking the essentials.
customer_reviews.text: I had tried a more bulky version of a running belt and hated it. This is so much better as once it's on you don't even realize it's there. I was so surprised that my phone does actually fit inside. When it arrived I didn't think it would because it's so small and sleek. It's well made and stays in place, great to go out running with and put my phone, key and credit card in it. I would also consider this when travelling as a place to store some hidden money, but I haven't used it for that purpose yet.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Versatile running belt
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of things I like about this running belt. First is the 2 pockets. I like to take my phone out to take pictures while I’m running but I’m always paranoid about my keys falling out. With this I can put my keys in the small pocket so my phone is by itself. The size is really good. It fit my iPhone 11 (including case) with room to spare. The belt is made with quality elastic so it is comfortably snug. It doesn’t bounce but it also doesn’t feel too tight. I am very happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: SDubGold

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item. It was exactly what I was looking for. I hate those armbands and didn't want anything feeling like extra baggage when I run. This item is perfect. You forget it is even there. It is waterproof too!
customer_reviews.author: mustangkid196

customer_reviews.title: Quality is low now!! Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Update 6/8/20: Sadly can’t give a good review here anymore. Had purchased a new belt to replace my old one which lasted years. Maybe quality has changed but not only did the plastic tightener break on the 3rd use but the weatherproofing on the zipper is already breaking apart. Really sad that the quality is this low now
customer_reviews.author: X Budd

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit, holds the essentials
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two different waist bands for working out, ended up giving the other one to my son as it doesn't hold my car keys and my phone both. Keeping this one for myself as it holds my keys (Fob, house keys, some loyalty cards) in the smaller pouch and my phone with case in the larger. I've worn it running several times now and have had no issues with py phone or keys getting wet despite high temps and humidity. The fit is adjustable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: High quality running belt
customer_reviews.text: I've never used one of these before but was looking for something more compact than a fanny pack to use for frequent long walks with my dog in all kinds of weather. This product will work well for that purpose and is versatile enough to use for other types of errands too. The belt is well made and adjustable enough to fit either me or my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Costello

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting running pack belt!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've really enjoyed my running belt pack. It snugs the phone to my waist with no bouncing. It's light but strong. Buckles and zippers work great. I look forward to this being a long time running companion.
customer_reviews.author: Craig W. Forbes

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: This product is genius. I'm a runner, and usually I store my phone in my jacket. However, on a hot day, who wants to wear a jacket? I searched for a while to find a running shirt with pockets...hard to come by. This product is EXACTLY what I needed. My iphone fits easily. It fits well while running. Honestly- could not ask for a better product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: Hands free, hiking, biking, running, travel and shopping. I use mine daily rather than carrying a purse. So much more convenient and healthy in the days of Covid19. Holds everything I need easily ~ phone, license, CC's, cash. Comfortable to wear inside or outside clothing.
customer_reviews.author: PKB

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the zipper pulls
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product. The pouches can really expand, to fit my large phone, for example, but are never bulky. They also do a good job of keeping out moisture from sweat. I did find the zipper pulls to be a little annoying, jingling around, so I cut them off and pull on the zipper mechanism itself. Not a perfect solution, but it works better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gavondo

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase! I just love how this fits so much I forget I'm wearing it. I wore it golfing, walking and travelling in a plane. It doesn't move around. Fits my larger phone and case and whatever else I needed. I will say it does have a bulky clip that might press into your back when sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Zipper splitting...Improper fit for iPhone7+
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a iPhone7+ with a very minimalist case on it. Extremely tight fit to the point that the zipper is splitting and it won't hold the phone safely. Very disappointing. Would not recommend for anyone that doesn't want to remove their phone case before every run.
customer_reviews.author: Brett M.

customer_reviews.title: The one you want
customer_reviews.text: This was such a well built product, I was shocked by the difference right out of the box. Ive owned similiar style belts for traveling, hiking and running but with Sport2people's belt I know I'm going places with it for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Dadincharge Oftheremote

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and neat yet can carry phone, keys and cash
customer_reviews.text: A very neat design. Took some getting used to as initially it alwayed kept moving higher on my tummy while jogging but once i get it on the right spot on my pants it usually stays for the entire run. When running fast (4minutes/km or more) it seems to move more but most time i get it to stay in place. It also does a good job keeping my phone, car key and petty cash dry as i have gotten soaked by unexpected showers on a few occasions. Overall a great accessory for runners.
customer_reviews.author: eddy3735

customer_reviews.title: Awesome running belt!
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot! It stays in place while I run along the path through the city. I opt to wear it at my natural waist. In the big pocket, I put my iPhone 5S. In the smaller pocket, are house keys, ID, and some cash. It's a streamlined fit. I really like that this is waterproof so I don't have to worry about the rain. I even use this when going to music festivals and I don't want to carry a purse. I think it's even more safe than a fanny pack because it fits so close to the body, I can't imagine someone opening it up without you knowing. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Pamcakes

customer_reviews.title: This belt is great for running
customer_reviews.text: This belt is great for running! I just tried it out on my 5 mile run and it didn't budge! It held my Samsung phone (in a Pelican case) with no problem whatsoever with room to spare! This is the best belt I've used by far! I'm a little scared it might get too big if I lose weight since it won't get any smaller, but at the moment, there are no complaints! I'm about a size 8.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Loved it... at first
customer_reviews.text: I've used it daily for 3 months (jogging, walking dogs), and the elastic just doesn't hold up to that level of use. Loved this running belt when I first ordered it. It's plenty waterproof for most runs, fits iPhoneX and keys, etc. After 3 months it's past due to replace—the elastic is so worn out that the belt falls right off while I'm walking. You can see that it's not durable: the edges are all puckered. Previously used a Spibelt, and that lasted for 5+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Jen R.

customer_reviews.title: Hold my iPhone X tightly and conspicuously
customer_reviews.text: Hold my iPhone X tightly and conspicuously, I also carry my ear buds casing and my face mask. Everything is kept tightly while I run and more important it all stay dry. To avoid damaging the zipper when I put my iPhone X in, I stretch the fabric and I close the zipper, it fits perfectly. I keep it tightly around my waist during my run and I have no issues. Highly recommended for the runner/walker that need to keep the minimum with them while they exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Domingo Aleman

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: I used this belt to carry my energy gel packs for the Spartan Race recently and this belt worked perfectly! There were times I forgot I even had it on! It never sagged down my waist and stayed nice and tight. Never felt the buckle digging into my side at all when I was crawling and stayed put through the entire race. Very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Seanan Dowling

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. The expandable pockets fit more than you think. I can fit my Samsung G S9 and corded ear buds in the larger pocket, and my ID, gum, key, lip balm in the smaller pocket. My only complaint is that the zipper pulls make a very noticeable jingling noise when I run. I have to tuck them into the zipper; otherwise the noise drives me crazy. That's not enough of an annoyance to knock it down a star though. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christian J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need for running.
customer_reviews.text: This belt is perfect. The larger pocket holds my phone (which has a pretty big case one it), while the smaller pocket is perfect for keys or a driver's license/credit card. The pockets are water resistant and I've never had any problems with it when I run in the rain. I'm a large guy (6'6", 250 lbs) and it fits me, but you can adjust it to fit smaller people too without issue. I don't even notice it when I'm running. I've been using one for years, and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t move when I run, and my sweat won’t damage my phone
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this for outdoor running to hold my phone. I have an iPhone 6S+ and it fit just fine. The waist band is very stretchy so it allows you to fit it snug around your waist so it doesn’t move when you run. I purchased black and wear it over an oversized black T-shirt and it blends in really well so it doesn’t look like a typical fanny pack. The inside lining is a water resistant material so i didn’t have to worry about my sweat damaging my phone. I’m excited to use this for more outdoor activities this summer. It’s going to be perfect for hiking :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: The package arrived in good condition. When I opened it up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as a lightning deal. The package arrived in good condition. When I opened it up, I was quite impressed with the belt. I like the way the pockets expand on opening them. The belt is perfect for my shopping trips. It is very well made and will last a long time. I especially like the fact that it is made of very sturdy elastic and should fit most people.
customer_reviews.author: Coyla Barber

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a medium sized phone, cards and keys...on a 32 inch waist.
customer_reviews.text: Great pack! Best I've used! Zero bouncing or rotation while running. The compartments are designed to be stretchy and compress the contents to prevent bouncing while running. That means some care must be taken when inserting your phone and zipping it shut. If you were too hasty in jamming the phone into the pocket I could see how one might damage the zipper. So be a little bit careful inserting your phone. But the benefit is that this pack does not bounce and it fit me very comfortably for running. Fit: I have a 32" waist and I have the straps adjusted to the middle of their range.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: It isn't the prettiest running belt I've owned but it does stay in place without bouncing around which is great. I've had many belts that twist and slide
customer_reviews.text: The pockets are much bigger than they look in the pictures. It is big enough to hold a galaxy 9 in an otterbox case with no problems. It isn't the prettiest running belt I've owned but it does stay in place without bouncing around which is great. I've had many belts that twist and slide. This one stays exactly where I put it without having to be cinched down to an extreme degree. The pockets are lined so that sweat doesn't seem to soak through to gear. I haven't tried it in the rain yet but it seems pretty trustworthy.
customer_reviews.author: TippyTripod

customer_reviews.title: Carries my Samsung Galaxy S8+, keys, wallet, all while running
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, I put a bunch of heavy-ish stuff in here and ran with it. It all fits and stays around my waist if I tighten it correctly. There's a little bit of a bounce, but that was expected as my phone is pretty heavy. Been using it for over a year now and it is a life changer, no more carrying my phone in my hands while I run. I usually run anywhere from 2 to 6 miles with this thing. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Brown

customer_reviews.title: Activewear seldom has pockets - here's your solution
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite pleased with this belt. I use it for walking, not running, so cannot speak to whether it bounces when you run. It certainly doesn't when I walk. In fact, I forget all about it, it's that comfortable. The zippers are sturdy, the pouch big enough for my iPhone, the entire design compact. I think it's a great buy at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: NH dreaming

customer_reviews.title: Buy, go run, feel comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Well worth it... I had been using cheap belts from wish. They'd last about 6 months before the cheap elastic would weaken and need adjustment. The zippers would also get stuck. This thing has nice strong elastic and very smooth zippers. Going to take me a few runs before I find the length adjustment sweet spot to ensure longevity. About the only downside I see is the pockets are different sizes. Personal preference is a 50/50 split.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck B

customer_reviews.title: Great for Amusement Parks
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine mainly for Amusement Parks. I like to keep my phone and car key with me at all times. I don't want to take a chance of dropping them out of a pocket or my hands during rides and roller coasters. You can't take bags or hip packs on most rides. This running belt was a perfect way to keep phone and key on me securely and discreetly. I am very happy with it so far. If it helps, my phone is a Samsung Galaxy S8. I have a card case phone cover. It fit fine in the running belt.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Eriksen

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels nicer than expected
customer_reviews.text: This belt actually looks sleeker than I would have expected. The pockets fold down pretty small if not in use. I am a US men’s size 30 waist and this sits pretty snug on me. Regular running experienced no issues with bounce (though the belt did ride up a bit). It took full squat jumps for things to finally bounce any, and even then it was minimal. The large pocket juuuuust fits my iPhone X with full OtterBox, which is a pretty big size. So I think just about any phone should fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: RichBoi

product_meta.title: Sport2People Running Pouch Belt, USA Patented, Runner Waist Pack iPhone X 7 8 10 11 for Men and Women (Black)
feature_bullets: ENJOY OUTDOOR OR GYM ACTIVITY CAREFREE AND HANDS-FREE! Now you can keep your phone and other necessities safe and concentrate on your training! TWO POCKETS TO CARRY ALL YOU NEED. Best Running Belt You Can Find with extended manufacturer‘s warranty!

SAVE YOUR PHONE FROM SCRATCHES: with 2 expandable pockets, one large, one small. Now you can handle the phone without other stuff accidentally falling out. Amazingly COMFORTABLE runners belt. IT DOESN’T BOUNCE. No rubbing.

WATER RESISTANT: high-quality material with a special-shaped zipper will keep your items dry in almost any weather condition. ADJUSTABLE LENGTH 27.5" to 40.5". SPECIAL EARPHONES HOLE for a pleasant workout experience.

SAFER, EASIER and MORE COMFORTABLE TRAVELING: Roomy running fanny pack for your valuables, put it around your waist, cover with shirt or jacket. Perfect for storing your essentials during large crowd events, sports or water-related activities etc.

BE SAFE AND SEEN while working out IN THE DARK with this runners belt with 3 REFLECTIVE DARTS. Running pack fits comfortably to your body and is small enough to fit in your gym bag. HAVE MORE FUN DURING your ACTIVITIES with our BEST sports waist pack.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
